subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] 3 DAY LIVE EVENT - starts today Sept 18th Keith Age, 	Dave and Tom Jones and many more
author: David Koenig
full_text:
Yes!!! thanks for the heads up!I like the channel.
Dave

On Fri, Sep 18, 2009 at 10:37 AM, Fransen, Debbie
<debbie.fransen@...>wrote:

>
>
> thx Misty for the heads up
> See ya in the chat !!!!!!
> deb
>
>  ------------------------------
> *From:* EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] *On
> Behalf Of *Misty Dawn
> *Sent:* Friday, September 18, 2009 7:40 AM
> *To:* EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> *Subject:* [EVP-ITC] 3 DAY LIVE EVENT - starts today Sept 18th Keith Age,
> Dave and Tom Jones and many more
>
>
>
>   *Ok guys I said I would try and give you guys a heads up since many of
> you enjoyed the past live events on PTN so here ya go. Paranormal Television
> Network is broadcasting another live event this weekend September 18th -
> 20th. *
> **
>  www.paranormaltvnetwork.com
> or
> www.paranormaltelevisionnetwork.com
> **
> *It will be free to watch and participate in the interactive chat. For
> more info you can check out www.octagonhall.com. Afternoon
> activities include many guest speakers on a variety of subjects,
> re-enactors, living history demo's, live cannon fire, raffles, contests, and
> music along with other activities. And yes they will be having a ghosthunt
> at night there as well for those who are interested in the paranormal side
> of the location. *
> **
> *Guest speakers at the Octagon Hall commemoration will include Bryan Bush,
> Dr. Ron Hatcher, Dr. Michael Trapasso, Paul Browning, Keith Age, Chris
> Dedman, and Rhiannon Waits. Paul Browning has written a book entitled
> Hauntings at Octagon Hall. Dave and Tom Jones Para-X Radio
> CBS Psychiconair Clarksville Ghost Hunters and a few surprise guests.*
> ****
> *GHOST HUNTERS WILL ENCOUNTER
> CIVIL WAR RE-ENACTORS SEPT. 18-20
> AS OCTAGON HALL MARKS 150 YEARS**
> *Franklin, Ky. -- Octagon Hall, an eight-sided brick antebellum home in
> Franklin, Ky., is observing the 150th anniversary of its completion. A
> three-day celebration Sept. 18, 19, and 20 will feature Civil War
> re-enactors and historians alongside paranormal investigators and ghost
> hunters.
> [image: Octagon Hall]
>
> Looks like another fun weekend event fundraiser to help with restoration of
> a historic landmark. If you cant make it out to the location then come join
> in watching it LIVE for free.
>
> Have a great day!
> Misty
>
>  
>

See ya in he cha !!!!!!
deb
